ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Why SPARQL endpoints aren't even remotely RESTful.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I recently got aware of Fuseki[1], a SPARQL server. The claim on the wiki is: It provides the REST-style SPARQL HTTP Update, and SPARQL Query and SPARQL

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Why SPARQL endpoints aren't even remotely RESTful.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=474754157; y=8VsKN-q8kDGNL5sX_omWaX4Jicb_PBlEsQss6MCj08rzxWFfM3kNHbeQ30WoZPOJYU4

Hi,

I recently got aware of Fuseki[1], a SPARQL server. The claim on the 
wiki is:

"It provides the REST-style SPARQL HTTP Update, and SPARQL Query and 
SPARQL Update using the SPARQL protocol over HTTP."

I think the "hypermedia as the engine of application state" constraint 
is not fulfilled, or?

Cheers,


Bob

[1] http://openjena.org/wiki/Fuseki
